website_summaries.verdict: Set of 4 traditional potholders stay cool in hot cooking conditions.
pros: Come in biscotti, black, cactus green, federal blue, graphite and paprika red
Can use as standard pot holders or as mitts
cons: Some think they are too small
Priced a little high for what you get compared to other choices

customer_reviews.title: Zero durability
customer_reviews.text: The size is good for my small hands, and the back pockets work OK (although would prefer just a simple pad), but the terry side sprouted holes within the first few days of using it (see photo). It was not exposed to anything sharp, so I can't explain why it did this, but I'm very disappointed. It is also not good at high temps.
customer_reviews.author: Contrary Mary

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Nothing
customer_reviews.text: The oven mitts I had previously were quite soft, very flexible and had a much more comfortable fit. They also contained a small magnet in each mitt, which was extremely useful. I kept mine on the refrigerator, grab and go. I had to buy a magnetized hook to hold these, necessitating having to wrestle them off the thing -- sometimes with only one hand free. Not handy at all...disappointing actually. I found a much better pair for less money, but by the time I got around to using these I felt it was too late to send them back. Hope they wear out quick.
customer_reviews.author: RJR

customer_reviews.title: I love the sturdiness and color of these
customer_reviews.text: I love the sturdiness and color of these! It is good to note that these literally function as pot holders where you put your hand in them! One side fits your thumb and the other side fits the rest of your fingers. These are thick, so I haven't accidentally burned my hand/fingers on anything yet. I do wish I'd bought bigger ones (if they're available) or at least 2 bigger ones (in addition to these smaller ones), as these are a little smaller than I expected (width wise at least) - but that's completely on me, since the dimensions are listed here.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Bad fit and stiff
customer_reviews.text: Your fingers are forced into pre sewn pockets. The problem is one is for a thumb and the other for a few fingers . When wearing these , the heels of your hands are exposed, and likely to get burned Very stiff Going back
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Washed these after receiving them- used warm water with my towels- and they shrunk and are unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha B

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous pot holders
customer_reviews.text: The potholders are too small. The pocket for the fingers is not deep enough. The pocket for the thumb is not deep enough. Trying to use these potholders requires too much concentration to try to keep them on your hand rather than paying attention to handling the hot container. I don't like them at all. Nothing good to say about them.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Good, but small.
customer_reviews.text: These have good padding. They are small. I can fit my hands in them (which aren't huge). The thing to pay attention to is that one half of the mitt you can fit four fingers into. The other half (you can tell by the stitching) is just big enough for one or two fingers. Then you're supposed to use it like a puppet's mouth. It works fine then. I just wish it was easier to visually distinguish the difference as you can fumble with it when you're in a rush (as I have done).
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Way too small;  insulating ability is unimpressive
customer_reviews.text: These pot holders are too small to set a hot container on, to protect your counter from heart. And they are almost too small to hold in your hand. Their insulating ability is only average. I have had better. Given that the primary purpose of a pot holder is to protect your hand from heat; one would hope that a manufacturer would have enough good sense to design it large enough to serve that primary function. But, they didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Apoiuwerhpga

customer_reviews.title: Really Like These
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fan of overly bulky potholders, so when I found these at a brick-and-mortar store I bought them. They are, at this point, old and pretty worn out, so I ordered this new set. I rarely use the pocket part, but I like that I'm not trying to remove a small casserole dish with a huge potholder. My original set washed well, so I'm hoping these do too. These would make a nice gift for a housewarming or bridal shower.
customer_reviews.author: TrishiaK

customer_reviews.title: These are terrible. They are too small to fit your fingers ...
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible. They are too small to fit your fingers inside and they do not have nearly enough insulation to protect your hands from cooking items that have been in the oven or on the stove. They are completely useless and I have the scorched fingers to prove it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and quick to protect your hands around the oven
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, easy to grab in an instant, these mitts are small enough to be unobtrusive, but large and thick enough to prevent burns. The deep crimson color really enhances my kitchen decor. Great design and great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Small  for the Task
customer_reviews.text: The pot holders work fine regarding using them for hot pots. But they are so small I think they made them for children. Difficult to get your fingers in the teeny little pockets. Also, regarding overall size, they are simply too little. What were they thinking? The size totally defeats the purpose: To keep your hands from getting burned.
customer_reviews.author: Monica E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: These aren't very heat-resistant
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I'm the dummy, but shouldn't pot-holders be able to handle heat? Two of these melted on the first use. I took a cookie sheet out of the oven and a hole melted right in the front. It's unfortunate, because the design of these is perfect. You don't have to slide on an entire glove- you can just put your thumb in the pocket hole and fingers in the other side. Easy on and off.
customer_reviews.author: eLM

customer_reviews.title: Decent but thin.
customer_reviews.text: Update 8/2020: I still really like these, but they are thinner than I'd prefer. If the oven is any higher than 400°F, it is necessary to use two or risk getting burned through the potholder. Disappointing, and it's an annoyance to have to remember to double up... and a painful reminder if I don't. Great little potholders especially handy for our cast iron skillets.
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: Potholder-Oven Mitt Hybrid
customer_reviews.text: These are nothing amazing when it comes to heat protection (average cloth potholder heat protection, I'd say), but what makes them so great is the compact size and simple shape. They're like a crossover mitt — a potholder oven mitt hybrid. They're as easy as a potholder to grab, but quicker and easier to slip into than a full mitt. And the size seems especially good for small-hand people like myself (though my husband, with normal man-sized hands, has no complaints).
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Not good enough
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these oven mitts twice. The first time I loved them and they were my go to mitts. The second time they were thinner and not nearly as protective. Last night I had my oven on 450 and took a cast iron skillet out and nearly burned myself. Thank goodness I had a place to place the skillet quickly!
customer_reviews.author: NH

customer_reviews.title: Mildew!
customer_reviews.text: These pot holders arrived today with a very strong smell of mold and mildew! As soon as I opened the plastic bag they came in I could smell it. I would never have this product near my food nor in my kitchen. They are being returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: smc

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: So far the only complaint I have is that the one side he's going to put a thumb in you can't stick your hand in both sides so there's only one way to hold
customer_reviews.author: Katy Qualls

customer_reviews.title: Small and cute
customer_reviews.text: Customer beware! These potholders are very small. They have a great fabric the color is wonderful. If you have normal size hands for a woman they barely cover your hand. If you have smaller hands like some of the other reviews that I’ve read they will work great for you. If you have a young chef in the house They will work great for children’s hands.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Shrinks!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because they were cotton, (spelled "coton" on the label), and when they arrived it said to wash before using-wash in cold water dry on low-which I did. They came out of the dryer wet -and shrunken beyond being useable for anything other than trivets. They are designed to put your fingers and thumb in pockets on the reverse side, yet after washing only your thumb and two fingers will fit. I am very disappointed and it is too much trouble to return them. Do not waste your money. Shrinks
customer_reviews.author: BarrrySL

customer_reviews.title: Preferred over oven mitts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set of four to replace two of these that I’ve had for several years and have begun to wear out. So easy to use, whether hung on the wall or laying flat on the counter, I just slip my fingers and thumb in, a one handed operation, and I’m ready to grasp my cast iron panini press or pans from the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H.

customer_reviews.title: X L N T
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a pair of these at a store years ago. They're getting old (but are not worn out) but I needed more for when the old ones are put in the washer. Obviously, I'm very happy with them. I'm glad Amazon has them.
customer_reviews.author: A Payne

customer_reviews.title: So glad I tried these!
customer_reviews.text: I needed new pores holders and decided to give these a try. To my surprise, I loved them. Easy to use and great for small hands. I have used them for everything from glass bowls of soup out the microwave to large Turkey pot out of the oven at Thanksgiving. Easy to use and comfortable. Haven't burnt my hands yet. Recommending them to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Ruschelle Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great design, long lasting.
customer_reviews.text: I received a pair of gold Ritz mitts 20+ years ago as a gift, and I loved them. Easy to put on, easy to use as a mitt, a grabber, or just a hotpad. When my dog destroyed one, I knew I had to get another! So I found these. I love the red color better than the gold (goes with my kitchen better), and they are slightly bigger than my old gold ones. I look forward to using them for an even longer time!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa BL Norwood

customer_reviews.title: Great Pot Holders
customer_reviews.text: I love these pot holders. I have used them for more than a year and they have held up well and are still going strong! I have both the traditional type of pot holders (that the entire hand goes into) and these dual-function pot holders, and I always reach for this kind because they are easier and more convenient to use. They also take up less space, which is a bonus for a small kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Krispi Bre

customer_reviews.title: Excellent to use, be warned the red dye took at least 3 washes to stop the color from bleeding
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to use and durable. Second time I've purchased them, I didn't remember the color bleeding from washing the first time I purchased, but I certainly have some pink towels these days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only oven mitts I'll ever buy
customer_reviews.text: I think these are hands down the best oven mitts I've ever owned. I love how they fit on my hands so securely. Some other mitts or pot holders I've used have been awkward and made me feel like I didn't have a good grip but these are so easy to use. I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Sooz

customer_reviews.title: Great product

customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: I was pleased with this purchase but if you have large fingers/hands ...
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with this purchase but if you have large fingers/hands or are looking for full coverage around your entire hand this may not be the product for you. Works as it's intended and does not take up too much space in our drawer.
customer_reviews.author: RogoRaptor

customer_reviews.title: You'll either love them or hate them
customer_reviews.text: These are not much bigger than the hand and don't protect the back of the hand, so you'll find that you need to use a bit more care with these than with traditional designs. If you're willing to do that, though, you'll find that the grip pockets for thumb and fingers work very well and that you're able to manoeuver hot cookware much more deftly and conveniently with these than with the usual great wads of terry or quilting. I think they're brilliant, but they may or may not suit you.
customer_reviews.author: Ludwig

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: Took me a long time to find these! I've been looking for this style for several years after our original pair gave out. So pleased to find them, great quality, fantastic color, great fit - and will order again when our current set needs replacing.

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size.

Personally, I find the standard square ones a bit large and clumsy; these are just the right size for most purposes (and I keep a square one handy for the exceptions).

customer_reviews.title: They are thick enough that you don't burn your hands but still very flexible, not bulky.

customer_reviews.text: These are really nice potholders. They are thick, comfortable, and protect against the heat well. The only thing I would have liked to see is a larger whole for your fingers in the tops and bottoms, but other than that I love these things.

customer_reviews.title: durable and black
customer_reviews.text: Looked everywhere for heavy duty pot holder in black with no printed cutesy picture on them and these were it. great quality and they have a pocket on one side to slip your thumb into and the other fingers too for a secure grip when reaching into the oven.
